sense.name: Provide evidence for; show by one's behavior, attitude, or external attributes; embody.
sense.examples: The buildings in Rome manifest a high level of architectural sophistication. This decision manifests his sense of fairness. She manifests all beauty and goodness.

sense.name: Record in a ship's manifest.
sense.examples: We manifested all the cargo by putting it into the ship's log. Every passenger must be manifested by a member of the crew.

sense.name: Come into existence; reveal its presence or make an apprearance.
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1 MANIFEST NP2[patient[concrete]] NP1[agent] MANIFEST Note: May be reflexive. Note: See final example. Unlike in Sense 1, the NP2 in Sense 2 becomes [concrete] by the action of the verb and thus may be considered concrete in the syntax.
sense.examples: The ghost manifests each year on the same day. The man manifested a large bulge near his liver, which doctors removed. We have to manifest our goals.
